title: Device ban
text: I have never done anything wrong on this app. I simply logged out to go onto an old and unused account to get photos from my memories and I went to login to either my active or inactive account and I got the “device ban” notification which I find to be completely unacceptable. I have been using Snapchat for almost 8 years now and I have NEVER had this issue before. I have never violated any of the Snapchat guidelines nor have I been hacked on my account. The fact that I cannot use the app on my device again is absurd. I pay for Snapchat+ and I follow all of the rules. I am unimpressed by the lack of customer support on your part. There is no reason to why I should be device banned not that there’s a reason given anyways. The fact that there’s no way to see why this has happened or a way to call and ask. Get it together.

title: Pretty good
text: I enjoy Snapchat and all of the features that it has to offer. I enjoy how you can not only send messages on Snapchat, but also videos and pictures. It is super customizable, including options to draw, add stickers, location pins, time stamps, and more. It’s really convenient, as opposed to taking a picture or video then having to put that into an imessage and then write what you want to say. Snapchat combines everything into one. You are also able to switch to a map view and see where your friends are on the map which is a very cool feature (of course if the user has it turned on). They continue to add new features which continue to give the app a novel feel. It makes it super easy to connect with others as well. I have heard negative things about the “snapchat subscription” options, but I have not looked thoroughly into that yet, as I don’t really know how.
